description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期北洋皖系军阀将领，段祺瑞的重要幕僚。
description.en: A general of the Anhui clique of the Beiyang warlords during the Republic of China era, and a key advisor to Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事家、政治家，北洋皖系军阀首领，曾任中华民国国务院总理、临时执政。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China, leader of the Anhui clique of Beiyang warlords, who served as Premier of the State Council and Provisional Chief Executive of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事家、政治家，北洋军阀的奠基人，曾任中华民国临时大总统、大总统。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China, founder of the Beiyang Army, who served as the first Provisional President and the second President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 日本于1874年至1945年间设立的陆军军官学校。
description.en: An army officer school established in Japan from 1874 to 1945.

description.zh-cn: 民国军阀中北洋军阀的一支，因其首领段祺瑞为安徽（简称皖）人而得名。
description.en: A faction of the Beiyang warlords during the Warlord Era of the Republic of China, named after its leader Duan Qirui, who was from Anhui (Wan) province.

description.zh-cn: 由徐树铮为段祺瑞起草，以武力威胁清廷，迫使宣统帝退位的电报。
description.en: A telegram drafted by Xu Shuzheng for Duan Qirui, which used military threat to force the Qing court to accept the abdication of the Xuantong Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清朝最后一位皇帝爱新觉罗·溥仪（宣统帝）正式颁布《退位诏书》，标志着清朝统治的结束。
description.en: The event where the last emperor of the Qing Dynasty, Aisin-Gioro Puyi (the Xuantong Emperor), formally issued the Imperial Edict of Abdication, marking the end of the Qing Dynasty's rule.

description.zh-cn: 清朝光绪帝的皇后，宣统帝的皇额娘，在宣统退位时垂帘听政。
description.en: The empress of the Guangxu Emperor of the Qing Dynasty and the empress dowager for the Xuantong Emperor, who acted as regent during the abdication.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北洋政府时期负责全国陆军军政的中央机构。
description.en: The central institution responsible for the national army's military administration during the Beiyang Government period of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期政治家，交通系首领。
description.en: A politician during the Republic of China era, leader of the Communications Clique.

description.zh-cn: 由徐树铮创办的中学，为首都师范大学附属中学的前身。
description.en: A middle school founded by Xu Shuzheng, the predecessor of the High School Affiliated to Capital Normal University.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期政治人物，曾两度担任中华民国大总统。
description.en: A political figure during the Republic of China era who twice served as the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北洋政府时期的中央行政机关。
description.en: The central executive organ of the Beiyang Government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军阀，曾于1917年发动兵变，拥立前清皇帝溥仪复辟。
description.en: A warlord during the Republic of China era who led a coup in 1917 to restore the former Qing emperor Puyi to the throne.

description.zh-cn: 1917年由张勋发动的、旨在恢复清朝统治的未遂政变。
description.en: An unsuccessful coup d'état in 1917, led by Zhang Xun, aimed at restoring the Qing dynasty's rule.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家、政治家、中华民国国父。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, statesman, and founding father of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1917年至1922年间，由孙中山领导的、反对北洋军阀统治的军事政治运动。
description.en: A military and political movement led by Sun Yat-sen from 1917 to 1922 against the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事家、政治家，北洋直系军阀首领，曾任中华民国副总统、代理大总统。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China, leader of the Zhili clique of Beiyang warlords, who served as Vice President and acting President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事家、政治家，北洋奉系军阀首领。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China, leader of the Fengtian clique of Beiyang warlords.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期北洋军阀直系将领。
description.en: A general of the Zhili clique of the Beiyang warlords during the Republic of China era.

description.zh-cn: 1919年由徐树铮组建的北洋政府军队，主要任务为管理西北边疆事务。
description.en: An army of the Beiyang government formed by Xu Shuzheng in 1919, primarily responsible for managing affairs in the northwestern frontier.

description.zh-cn: 1919年中华民国北洋政府宣布废除外蒙古自治的事件。
description.en: The event in 1919 when the Beiyang government of the Republic of China announced the abolition of Outer Mongolia's autonomy.

description.zh-cn: 一场始于欧洲的全球性战争。
description.en: A global war that began in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家。
description.en: An East Asian country.

description.zh-cn: 民国军阀中北洋军阀的一支，因其首领冯国璋为直隶（今河北）人而得名。
description.en: A faction of the Beiyang warlords during the Warlord Era of the Republic of China, named after the native province of its founder Feng Guozhang, Zhili (modern Hebei).

description.zh-cn: 1920年发生于中国北京、天津地区的直系军阀与皖系军阀间的战争。
description.en: A war in 1920 between the Zhili and Anhui cliques for control of the Beiyang government, which took place in the Beijing and Tianjin areas of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事家、政治家，北洋军阀直系将领，后成为西北军领袖。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China, a general of the Zhili clique of Beiyang warlords, who later became the leader of the Northwestern Army.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事家，冯玉祥部下。
description.en: A military figure in the Republic of China, a subordinate of Feng Yuxiang.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮三子。
description.en: Third son of Xu Shuzheng.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮出生于江苏省徐州府萧县官桥镇醴泉村，今属安徽。
description.en: Xu Shuzheng was born in Liquan Village, Guanqiao Town, Xiao County, Xuzhou Prefecture, Jiangsu Province, which is now part of Anhui.

description.zh-cn: 1901年，徐树铮遇到段祺瑞，成为其书记官。此后长期作为段祺瑞的重要幕僚和下属，担任过总参谋、秘书长、参谋长等职务。
description.en: In 1901, Xu Shuzheng met Duan Qirui and became his secretary. He subsequently served as a key advisor and subordinate to Duan for many years, holding positions such as chief of staff and secretary-general.

description.zh-cn: 1905年被段祺瑞送到日本，1908年入学士官学校步兵科第七期，次年毕业。
description.en: Sent to Japan by Duan Qirui in 1905, he enrolled in the 7th class of the Infantry Department at the Army Officers' School in 1908 and graduated the following year.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮是北洋皖系军阀将领。
description.en: Xu Shuzheng was a general of the Anhui clique of the Beiyang warlords.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮为段祺瑞起草了《共和之电》。
description.en: Xu Shuzheng drafted the 'Telegram of the Republic' for Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 《共和之电》以武力威胁，迫使隆裕太后同意宣统退位。
description.en: The 'Telegram of the Republic' used military threat to compel Empress Dowager Longyu to agree to the abdication of the Xuantong Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 1914年12月，徐树铮与梁士诒订立合同创办正志中学。
description.en: In December 1914, Xu Shuzheng signed a contract with Liang Shiyi to found Zhengzhi Middle School.

description.zh-cn: 与徐树铮订立合同租赁粤东学堂校舍创办正志中学。
description.en: Signed a contract with Xu Shuzheng to lease the premises of the Yuedong School to establish Zhengzhi Middle School.

description.zh-cn: 因常对黎元洪蛮横无理，并与总统府交恶，酿成府院之争。
description.en: His frequent arrogant and unreasonable behavior towards Li Yuanhong and his conflict with the Presidential Palace led to the 'Dispute between the Palace and the Cabinet'.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮策动张勋以辫军驱逐黎元洪，拥立宣统帝复辟。
description.en: Xu Shuzheng instigated Zhang Xun to use the 'Queue Army' to expel Li Yuanhong and restore the Xuantong Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 主张武力统一中国，消灭陆荣廷、孙中山的南方护法军。
description.en: Advocated for the military unification of China and the elimination of the southern Constitutional Protection Army led by Lu Rongting and Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 幕后策划督军团对冯国璋施加压力，并组织安福俱乐部，阻止其连任总统。
description.en: He masterminded pressure on Feng Guozhang from the military governors' group and organized the Anfu Club to prevent Feng's re-election as president.

description.zh-cn: 1918年初，徐树铮到奉天唆使张作霖派兵入关，并取得其信任被委任为奉军副司令。
description.en: In early 1918, Xu Shuzheng went to Fengtian to incite Zhang Zuolin to send troops through the Shanhai Pass, gaining his trust and being appointed deputy commander of the Fengtian Army.

description.zh-cn: 不久徐树铮触怒张作霖，于1918年8月被解除副司令职务。
description.en: Shortly after, Xu Shuzheng angered Zhang Zuolin and was dismissed from his post as deputy commander in August 1918.

description.zh-cn: 在天津设鸿门宴，将直系将领陆建章枪杀。
description.en: He set up a 'Hongmen Banquet' in Tianjin and had the Zhili clique general Lu Jianzhang shot.

description.zh-cn: 率西北边防军进入外蒙古，以武力胁迫外蒙古王公派在1919年11月17日宣布撤销自治。
description.en: He led the Northwest Frontier Army into Outer Mongolia and used military force to compel the Outer Mongolian nobility to declare the cancellation of autonomy on November 17, 1919.

description.zh-cn: 因徐树铮成功促成外蒙撤治而电贺，对其做出极高评价。1921年计划联合段祺瑞、张作霖组成三角同盟时，徐树铮代表段祺瑞与孙中山会谈。
description.en: Sun Yat-sen sent a congratulatory telegram to Xu Shuzheng for his success in bringing about the cancellation of Outer Mongolia's autonomy and praised him highly. When planning to form a triangular alliance with Duan Qirui and Zhang Zuolin in 1921, Xu Shuzheng represented Duan in talks with Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 直皖战争皖系战败后，徐树铮被指控为“十大祸首”之最而遭通缉，被迫逃亡。
description.en: After the Anhui clique was defeated in the Zhili-Anhui War, Xu Shuzheng was accused of being the foremost of the 'ten great culprits', a warrant was issued for his arrest, and he was forced to flee.

description.zh-cn: 1920年，直皖两系军阀斗争激烈，爆发直皖战争。
description.en: In 1920, the struggle between the Zhili and Anhui warlord cliques intensified, leading to the outbreak of the Zhili-Anhui War.

description.zh-cn: 因徐树铮曾杀害其妻子的姑父陆建章，冯玉祥派部下张之江趁徐树铮途经廊坊时将其绑架并杀害。
description.en: Because Xu Shuzheng had killed Lu Jianzhang, the uncle of Feng Yuxiang's wife, Feng dispatched his subordinate Zhang Zhijiang to kidnap and kill Xu as he passed through Langfang.

description.zh-cn: 奉冯玉祥之命，在廊坊车站绑架并杀害了徐树铮。
description.en: Under Feng Yuxiang's orders, he kidnapped and killed Xu Shuzheng at Langfang Railway Station.

description.zh-cn: 张之江是冯玉祥的部下。
description.en: Zhang Zhijiang was a subordinate of Feng Yuxiang.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮假借参加第一次世界大战的名义，向日本借款，编练参战军，为其在直皖战争中积累了军事资本。
description.en: Under the pretext of participating in World War I, Xu Shuzheng borrowed money from Japan to train the 'War Participation Army', accumulating military capital for the Zhili-Anhui War.

description.zh-cn: 徐树铮假借参加第一次世界大战的名义，向日本借得巨款，编练参战军。
description.en: Under the pretext of participating in World War I, Xu Shuzheng borrowed a large sum of money from Japan to train the 'War Participation Army'.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯曾评价徐树铮：“又铮其人，亦有小才，如循正轨，可期远到。但傲岸自是，开罪于人特多”。
description.en: Yuan Shikai once commented on Xu Shuzheng: 'Youzheng is a man of some talent. If he follows the right path, he can go far. But he is arrogant and self-righteous, offending many people'.

description.zh-cn: 徐道隣是徐树铮的三子。
description.en: Xu Daolin is the third son of Xu Shuzheng.
